Description: Fragment of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, perhaps an oenochoe. Glazed area at bottom of sherd below frieze depicting men wearing chlamides with hunting dogs; figure on left strides to right, his dog raising a paw; central figure faces left, his dog between his feet; he holds a staff or spear; to right a figure probably in himation holding a staff or spear, facing left; much added red detail.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (IIIh pl. 3, 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2058)
Exhibition history: On loan to Classics Centre in Oxford. Previous location: AN Bothmer Cabinet 58.6 Attic Black-Figure
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
